<script type="text/javascript">
var maindomain_lang = 'https://www.paloaltonetworks.com';
var main_site_url = 'https://www.paloaltonetworks.com';
var ajax_url = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-admin/admin-ajax.php';	
function getParameterByName(name, url) {
		if(url == null){
		  url = window.location.href;
		}
	    name = name.replace(/[\[\]]/g, '\\$&');
	    var regex = new RegExp('[?&]' + name + '(=([^&#]*)|&|#|$)'),
		results = regex.exec(url);
	    if (!results) return null;
	    if (!results[2]) return '';
	    return decodeURIComponent(results[2].replace(/\+/g, ' '));
	}
	var container_q = getParameterByName('container');
	var d_lang = 'en';	
</script>

<meta property="og:author_image_link" content="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/unit-news-meta.svg"/>
<meta property="og:author_image_link" content="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/unit-news-meta.svg"/>
<meta property="og:author_image_link" content="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/unit-news-meta.svg"/>
<meta property="og:author_image_link" content="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/unit-news-meta.svg"/>
<meta name="post_tags" content="GenAI,phishing"/>
<script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https:\/\/schema.org","@type":"BlogPosting","headline":"Fashionable Phishing Bait: GenAI on the Hook","name":"Fashionable Phishing Bait: GenAI on the Hook","description":"GenAI-created phishing campaigns misuse tools ranging from website builders to text generators in order to create more convincing and scalable attacks.","url":"https:\/\/unit42.paloaltonetworks.com\/genai-phishing-bait\/","mainEntityOfPage":"https:\/\/unit42.paloaltonetworks.com\/genai-phishing-bait\/","datePublished":"August 19, 2025","articleBody":"Executive Summary\r\nThe rapid expansion of generative AI (GenAI) has led to a diverse set of web-based platforms offering capabilities such as code assistance, natural language generation, chatbot interaction and automated website creation. This article uses insights from our telemetry to show trends in how the GenAI web is evolving.\r\n\r\nBecause of its growing prevalence, GenAI also opens new vectors for threat actors to misuse. Adversaries are increasingly leveraging GenAI platforms to create realistic phishing content, clone trusted brands and automate large-scale deployment using services like low-code site builders. The threats are getting harder to detect.\r\n\r\nWe examine specific misuse scenarios including AI-generated phishing pages and malicious chatbots. We also provide indicators of these activities to support detection and response efforts.\r\n\r\nPalo Alto Networks customers are better protected from the threats described in this article by the following products and services:\r\n\r\nAdvanced URL Filtering and Advanced DNS Security identify known domains and URLs associated with this activity as malicious.\r\n\r\nIf you think you might have been compromised or have an urgent matter, contact the Unit 42 Incident Response team.\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\nRelated Unit 42 Topics\r\nGenAI, Phishing\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\nIncrease in the Use of GenAI\r\nIntroduction to Web-Based AI Services\r\nGenAI has fueled a surge of new websites and platforms, from conversational assistants to multi-media creation tools. As the ecosystem evolves, we identify emerging patterns in how people are adopting different categories of AI services.\r\n\r\nWriting assistants, meeting tools, code generators and website builders are streamlining tasks that previously demanded substantial manual effort, signaling a shift in how work is created and delivered across domains.These AI tools streamline workflows, reduce manual effort and enable new forms of content creation.\r\n\r\nWe are observing a significant upward trend in GenAI adoption across industries, particularly following the surge of public interest and innovation in the AI space. Within just six months, AI use has more than doubled and continues to grow steadily, as shown in Figure 1.\r\n\r\nThe blue line represents the number of AI website visits in billions, from April 2024-April 2025. The red bars indicate the number of new websites hosting AI services detected in millions. This overall trend of increased traffic to AI websites indicates a growing adoption of GenAI applications and services.\r\n\r\n[caption id=\"attachment_152042\" align=\"alignnone\" width=\"1000\"] Figure 1. Month-over-month trends in AI website traffic and growth from April 2024 to April 2025.[\/caption]\r\nAI Service Trends and Industry Focus\r\nWe discuss how people are adopting AI-specific capabilities so we can better predict how those various functions can introduce new risks. A further review of our telemetry reveals:\r\n\r\n \tThe top industries leading AI adoption include:\r\n\r\n \tHigh tech\r\n \tEducation\r\n \tTelecommunications\r\n \tProfessional and legal services\r\n\r\n\r\n \tThe high tech sector dominates AI use, accounting for over 70% of total GenAI tool use shown in Figure 2\r\n \tMost of this activity is concentrated in text-generation applications (such as writing assistants and AI chatbots) and media-generation tools, as shown in Figure 3\r\n \tAbout 16% of AI service use is dedicated to data processing and workflow automation, such as email campaign generation\r\n\r\n[caption id=\"attachment_152291\" align=\"alignnone\" width=\"900\"] Figure 3. Distribution of AI categories across all industries.[\/caption]\r\n\r\n[caption id=\"attachment_152064\" align=\"alignnone\" width=\"900\"] Figure 3. Distribution of AI categories across all industries.[\/caption]\r\nOverview of Phishing Attacks Misusing Various Types of AI Services\r\nWhile GenAI tools offer powerful capabilities, they also introduce significant risks that threat actors can exploit for phishing and other types of cyberattacks.\r\n\r\n \tAI code assistants can significantly enhance software development. They provide real-time coding suggestions, automate code generation and can reduce errors. However, they can inadvertently expose proprietary code or sensitive intellectual property, creating entry points for targeted attacks.\r\n \tText generation tools \u2014 such as conversational, writing and meeting assistants \u2014 can enhance productivity, content creation and customer interaction. However, attackers can manipulate them to generate convincing phishing content, spread misinformation or leak confidential data.\r\n \tAI model services simplify deployment, training and inference. However, they can expose sensitive models or data to unauthorized access. This increases the risk of model hijacking or misuse in malicious workflows.\r\n \tAttackers can use multi-media AI tools \u2014 including media generators and website builders \u2014 to rapidly create realistic-looking but fraudulent websites, deepfake content and deceptive phishing pages to mimic trusted brands.\r\n \tAI-powered data platforms and workflow automation tools optimize business processes, improve efficiency and support informed decision-making. When loosely governed, they can become vectors for data leakage, unauthorized access and automated exploitation across integrated systems.\r\n\r\nCollectively, these risks underscore the potential of GenAI to amplify phishing campaigns and other social engineering threats. Therefore, stronger safeguards and threat detection are necessary.\r\n\r\nFigure 4 shows the top three AI services misused for phishing include:\r\n\r\n \tWebsite generators (approximately 40%)\r\n \tWriting assistants (approximately 30%)\r\n \tChatbots (almost 11%)\r\n\r\n[caption id=\"attachment_152075\" align=\"alignnone\" width=\"2048\"] Figure 4. Distribution of categories of AI services misused for phishing attacks.[\/caption]\r\nMisuse of Website Generation Services\r\nAlthough these services are relatively new, attackers are already misusing AI-powered website builders for real-world phishing attacks.\r\n\r\nWe observed phishing websites that threat actors created using a popular AI-powered website builder, which is capable of producing websites within seconds. This platform allows someone to enter a prompt that can build and publish websites without any email or phone verification. The site uses AI to generate images and text based on this prompt, for creating a website.\r\n\r\nWe detected two real-world examples of AI-generated phishing landing pages in May 2025. Both of these phishing pages, shown in Figures 5 and 6, link to attacker-owned credential-stealing sites.\r\n\r\n[caption id=\"attachment_152086\" align=\"alignnone\" width=\"1000\"] Figure 5. Screenshot of the phishing page seen in May 2025.[\/caption]\r\n\r\n[caption id=\"attachment_152097\" align=\"alignnone\" width=\"1000\"] Figure 6. Screenshot of the phishing page seen in May 2025.[\/caption]\r\n\r\nSome of the AI-assisted website builders we investigated appear to lack guardrails that would prevent someone from impersonating an existing business or organization. As a test, we used a known AI-assisted website builder to create a fake page to appear as if it\u2019s for Palo Alto Networks.\r\n\r\nThe website builder only required a valid email address (not necessarily a Palo Alto Networks email address) to establish a trial account and publish a page impersonating our company. Since these pages are intended to quickly establish a web presence for a new company or organization, they lack the design elements that criminals would otherwise use to spoof a targeted brand.\r\n\r\nIn our test, the website builder promised to generate a free AI website in 60 seconds, which is an accurate statement. Our only input was a brief description of the company for an initial text prompt. Figure 7 shows a brief description of Palo Alto Networks we typed in the initial prompt before clicking on the \u201cEnhance Prompt\u201d button.\r\n\r\n[caption id=\"attachment_152108\" align=\"alignnone\" width=\"1000\"] Figure 7. A brief description of our company in a prompt from the AI-assisted website builder.[\/caption]\r\n\r\nThe Enhance Prompt button took our initial input and created a complete AI prompt for the page, as shown below in Figure 8. The finished prompt included an AI-generated paragraph about the company, a default design style that can easily be modified and a list of content to include on the site.\r\n\r\n[caption id=\"attachment_152119\" align=\"alignnone\" width=\"1000\"] Figure 8. The enhanced prompt from the AI-assisted website builder.[\/caption]\r\n\r\nWe then clicked on the arrow button noted in Figure 8, and the builder took approximately 5-10 seconds to create a staging environment for the site. From a hastily typed initial prompt of \u201cPalo Alto Networks is a leading cybersecurity company that has next-generation firewalls and other security solutions,\u201d the resulting page Figure 9 shows looks plausible for a cybersecurity company.\r\n\r\n[caption id=\"attachment_152130\" align=\"alignnone\" width=\"1000\"] Figure 9. Index page generated by the AI-assisted website builder.[\/caption]\r\n\r\nScrolling through the index page generated by the site builder, we found a convincing AI-generated description of our company, as shown in Figure 10.\r\n\r\n[caption id=\"attachment_152141\" align=\"alignnone\" width=\"1000\"] Figure 10. Company description in a page generated by the AI-assisted website builder.[\/caption]\r\n\r\nThe index page included links to different pages that contain descriptions of next-generation firewalls, cloud security solutions and threat intelligence services. Figure 11 shows a link from the index page for threat intelligence services and the resulting page from that link. Like the company description, the description of these services mimics what most people would expect from an established cybersecurity company.\r\n\r\n[caption id=\"attachment_152152\" align=\"alignnone\" width=\"1000\"] Figure 11. Threat intelligence services page generated by the AI-assisted website builder.[\/caption]\r\n\r\nThe website builder includes a button to publish the site. Pushing this button generated the dialogue window shown in Figure 12.\r\n\r\n[caption id=\"attachment_152163\" align=\"alignnone\" width=\"1000\"] Figure 12. Dialogue window to publish the site from our test.[\/caption]\r\n\r\nWhile we did not publish this fake Palo Alto Networks site, cybercriminals have misused this builder to publish phishing pages mimicking other brands, such as the two real-world examples we previously referenced.\r\n\r\nAttackers can replicate similar attack vectors on other website builder platforms since many of these platforms have recently added AI-assisted features. Figure 13 shows an example of a fake gift card site spoofing popular vendors created through a popular website builder.\r\n\r\n[caption id=\"attachment_152174\" align=\"alignnone\" width=\"1000\"] Figure 13. Webpage for discounted gift cards generated on another popular AI-powered website builder.[\/caption]\r\n\r\nCurrently, the real-world phishing attacks seen on AI-powered website builders appear relatively rudimentary and might not deceive most potential victims. However, in the medium to long term, we expect that these attacks will become more convincing as AI-powered website builders grow more powerful.\r\nMisuse of Writing Assistant Services\r\nIn addition to website builders, we identified multiple real-world phishing URLs generated and hosted on third-party AI writing assistant platforms. In all these cases, the attacker used the app to host a phishing page. The phishing page displays a generic message like \u201cYou have new documents \u2014 click the button to view.\u201d Clicking the button leads the victim to a secondary credential-stealing site, such as a fake Microsoft login page.\r\n\r\nDespite being hosted on platforms that offer AI-powered content generation, these phishing pages are quite simple and show no clear signs of AI involvement (see Figures 14 and 15). This type of activity is similar to what we\u2019ve seen in software as service (SaaS) platform misuse campaigns, such as phishing pages hosted on presentation builders or other legitimate content-sharing tools.\r\n\r\n[caption id=\"attachment_152185\" align=\"alignnone\" width=\"1000\"] Figure 14. Screenshot of a phishing page created on an SEO assistant platform.[\/caption]\r\n\r\n[caption id=\"attachment_152196\" align=\"alignnone\" width=\"1000\"] Figure 15. Screenshot of the phishing page created on a sales assistant platform.[\/caption]\r\n\r\nWhile attackers might leverage the AI functionality of these platforms in more powerful ways in the future, they are currently using these platforms primarily as a hosting service for malicious content.\r\nConclusion\r\nIn this article, we discussed web-based GenAI services and reviewed phishing attacks that misused them. We investigated examples of phishing pages from AI-powered website builders, and explored how criminals can use these builders to create phishing content more easily. Criminals have also misused AI-powered writing assistant services, but these platforms have been used primarily as a hosting service for malicious content with no clear signs of AI involvement.\r\n\r\nOur telemetry reflects the growing adoption of GenAI applications and services, and we expect a corresponding increase in attacks that take advantage of GenAI as time passes.\r\n\r\nPalo Alto Networks customers are better protected from the threats discussed in this article through the following products:\r\n\r\n \tAdvanced URL Filtering and Advanced DNS Security identify known domains and URLs associated with this activity as malicious.\r\n\r\nIf you think you may have been compromised or have an urgent matter, get in touch with the Unit 42 Incident Response team or call:\r\n\r\n \tNorth America: Toll Free: +1 (866) 486-4842 (866.4.UNIT42)\r\n \tUK: +44.20.3743.3660\r\n \tEurope and Middle East: +31.20.299.3130\r\n \tAsia: +65.6983.8730\r\n \tJapan: +81.50.1790.0200\r\n \tAustralia: +61.2.4062.7950\r\n \tIndia: 00080005045107\r\n\r\nPalo Alto Networks has shared these findings with our fellow Cyber Threat Alliance (CTA) members. CTA members use this intelligence to rapidly deploy protections to their customers and to systematically disrupt malicious cyber actors. Learn more about the Cyber Threat Alliance.\r\nAcknowledgments\r\nThanks to Peng Peng for his research into malicious chatbots, as well as Alex Starov and Jun Javier Wang for their suggestions.\r\nAppendix\r\nAdditional screenshots of GenAI-related phishing pages we found in the wild are shown in Figures 16-22.\r\n\r\n[caption id=\"attachment_152266\" align=\"alignnone\" width=\"1000\"] Figure 16. An additional screenshot of the phishing site from Figure 5.[\/caption]\r\n\r\n[caption id=\"attachment_152277\" align=\"alignnone\" width=\"1000\"] Figure 17. Screenshot of a phishing page hosted on an AI-powered website platform initially sent via a phishing email. This webpage links to a fake login page for a popular web-based service.[\/caption]\r\n\r\n[caption id=\"attachment_152207\" align=\"alignnone\" width=\"1000\"] Figure 18. Spoofed gift card shopping page generated on a website builder.[\/caption]\r\n\r\n[caption id=\"attachment_152218\" align=\"alignnone\" width=\"1000\"] Figure 19. Screenshot of a phishing page generated using an AI-powered design assistant site.[\/caption]\r\n\r\n[caption id=\"attachment_152229\" align=\"alignnone\" width=\"1000\"] Figure 20. Screenshot of a phishing page generated on an AI-powered design assistant site.[\/caption]\r\n\r\n[caption id=\"attachment_152240\" align=\"alignnone\" width=\"1000\"] Figure 21. Screenshot of a landing phishing page generated on a no-code app builder.[\/caption]\r\n\r\n[caption id=\"attachment_152251\" align=\"alignnone\" width=\"1000\"] Figure 22. Screenshot of a phishing page generated on an AI-powered educational platform.[\/caption]","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","@id":"#panworg"},"image":{"@type":"ImageObject","url":"https:\/\/unit42.paloaltonetworks.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2025\/08\/03_Security-Technology_Category_1920x900-300x300.jpg","width":300,"height":300},"speakable":{"@type":"SpeakableSpecification","xPath":["\/html\/head\/title","\/html\/head\/meta[@name='description']\/@content"]},"author":[{"@type":"Person","name":"Zeyu You"},{"@type":"Person","name":"Beliz Kaleli"},{"@type":"Person","name":"Lucas Hu"},{"@type":"Person","name":"Wei Wang"}]}</script><link rel='stylesheet' id='crayon-css' href='https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/plugins/crayon-syntax-highlighter/css/min/crayon.min.css?ver=_2.7.2_beta' media='all' />

#ffffff;--wp--preset--color--pale-pink: #f78da7;--wp--preset--color--vivid-red: #cf2e2e;--wp--preset--color--luminous-vivid-orange: #ff6900;--wp--preset--color--luminous-vivid-amber: #fcb900;--wp--preset--color--light-green-cyan: #7bdcb5;--wp--preset--color--vivid-green-cyan: #00d084;--wp--preset--color--pale-cyan-blue: #8ed1fc;--wp--preset--color--vivid-cyan-blue: #0693e3;--wp--preset--color--vivid-purple: #9b51e0;--wp--preset--gradient--vivid-cyan-blue-to-vivid-purple: linear-gradient(135deg,rgba(6,147,227,1) 0%,rgb(155,81,224) 100%);--wp--preset--gradient--light-green-cyan-to-vivid-green-cyan: linear-gradient(135deg,rgb(122,220,180) 0%,rgb(0,208,130) 100%);--wp--preset--gradient--luminous-vivid-amber-to-luminous-vivid-orange: linear-gradient(135deg,rgba(252,185,0,1) 0%,rgba(255,105,0,1) 100%);--wp--preset--gradient--luminous-vivid-orange-to-vivid-red: linear-gradient(135deg,rgba(255,105,0,1) 0%,rgb(207,46,46) 100%);--wp--preset--gradient--very-light-gray-to-cyan-bluish-gray:     <script type="text/javascript">
    ;(function(win, doc, style, timeout) {
    var STYLE_ID = 'at-body-style';
    function getParent() {
    return doc.getElementsByTagName('head')[0];
    }
    function addStyle(parent, id, def) {
        if (!parent) {
        return;
        }
        var style = doc.createElement('style');
        style.id = id;
        style.innerHTML = def;
        parent.appendChild(style);
    }
    function removeStyle(parent, id) {
        if (!parent) {
            return;
        }
        var style = doc.getElementById(id);
        if (!style) {
            return;
        }
        parent.removeChild(style);
    }
    addStyle(getParent(), STYLE_ID, style);
    setTimeout(function() {
    removeStyle(getParent(), STYLE_ID);
    }, timeout);
    }(window, document, "body {visibility:hidden !important}", 3000));
    </script>

<script type="text/javascript">
var isIE11 = !!navigator.userAgent.match(/Trident.*rv\:11\./);
if(isIE11){
    var polyfill = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/dist/scripts/polyfill.min.js';
    document.write('<script type="text/javascript" src="'+polyfill+'">\x3C/script>');
}
    /**
 * String.prototype.replaceAll() polyfill
 * https://gomakethings.com/how-to-replace-a-section-of-a-string-with-another-one-with-vanilla-js/
 * @author Chris Ferdinandi
 * @license MIT
 */
if (!String.prototype.replaceAll) {
	String.prototype.replaceAll = function(str, newStr){
		// If a regex pattern
		if (Object.prototype.toString.call(str).toLowerCase() === '[object regexp]') {
			return this.replace(str, newStr);
		}
		// If a string
		return this.replace(new RegExp(str, 'g'), newStr);
	};
}

    /*! lozad.js - v1.16.0 - 2020-09-06 */
!function(t,e){"object"==typeof exports&&"undefined"!=typeof module?module.exports=e():"function"==typeof define&&define.amd?define(e):t.lozad=e()}(this,function(){"use strict";
/**
   * Detect IE browser
   * @const {boolean}
   * @private
   */var g="undefined"!=typeof document&&document.documentMode,f={rootMargin:"0px",threshold:0,load:function(t){if("picture"===t.nodeName.toLowerCase()){var e=t.querySelector("img"),r=!1;null===e&&(e=document.createElement("img"),r=!0),g&&t.getAttribute("data-iesrc")&&(e.src=t.getAttribute("data-iesrc")),t.getAttribute("data-alt")&&(e.alt=t.getAttribute("data-alt")),r&&t.append(e)}if("video"===t.nodeName.toLowerCase()&&!t.getAttribute("data-src")&&t.children){for(var a=t.children,o=void 0,i=0;i<=a.length-1;i++)(o=a[i].getAttribute("data-src"))&&(a[i].src=o);t.load()}t.getAttribute("data-poster")&&(t.poster=t.getAttribute("data-poster")),t.getAttribute("data-src")&&(t.src=t.getAttribute("data-src")),t.getAttribute("data-srcset")&&t.setAttribute("srcset",t.getAttribute("data-srcset"));var n=",";if(t.getAttribute("data-background-delimiter")&&(n=t.getAttribute("data-background-delimiter")),t.getAttribute("data-background-image"))t.style.backgroundImage="url('"+t.getAttribute("data-background-image").split(n).join("'),url('")+"')";else if(t.getAttribute("data-background-image-set")){var d=t.getAttribute("data-background-image-set").split(n),u=d[0].substr(0,d[0].indexOf(" "))||d[0];// Substring before ... 1x

</script>

  <div class="container px-sm-30">
    <ul id="menu-primary-navigation" class="main-menu d-sm-flex font-weight-medium"><li id="menu-item-97290" class="menu-item menu-item-type-post_type menu-item-object-page menu-item-97290"><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/tools/">Tools</a></li>
<li id="menu-item-41" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-41"><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/atoms/">ATOMs</a></li>
<li id="menu-item-119884" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-119884"><a target="_blank" href="https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/unit42">Security Consulting</a></li>
<li id="menu-item-81229" class="menu-item menu-item-type-post_type menu-item-object-page menu-item-81229"><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/about-unit-42/">About Us</a></li>
<li id="menu-item-121229" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-121229"><a href="https://start.paloaltonetworks.com/contact-unit42.html"><b style="color:#C84727">Under Attack?</b></a></li>
</ul>  </div>
</nav>
<div class="panClean pan-template-home" id="main-nav-menu-cont" style="display:none;">
    <div class="cleanHeader mainNavigationComp baseComponent parbase">
        <div class="productNav2021Component dark default" id="PAN_2021_NAV_ASYNC">
        </div>
  </div>
<div class="cleanTopHtml htmlComp baseComponent parbase"><div class="base-component-spacer spacer-none  "></div>
</div>
</div>
<!--  Start: Scripts Migrated From Unit42-v5 -->
<script type="text/javascript">
	function getCookie(cname) {
	 	var name = cname + "=";
  		var decodedCookie = decodeURIComponent(document.cookie);
		var ca = decodedCookie.split(';');
  		for(var i = 0; i <ca.length; i++) {
    			var c = ca[i];
    			while (c.charAt(0) == ' ') {
     				 c = c.substring(1);
    			}
    			if (c.indexOf(name) == 0) {
    				 return c.substring(name.length, c.length);
    			}
  		}
  		return "";
	}

	var referer = "";//sessionStorage.container;
	var pcontainer = sessionStorage.getItem("container");
	var searchResultsPagePath = "";
	if(((pcontainer) && pcontainer.indexOf('Prisma')!=-1)){
	    referer = 'Prisma' ;
	}        
        else if(((pcontainer) && pcontainer.indexOf('Cortex')!=-1)){
            if( pcontainer.indexOf('CloudCortex') != -1){
                referer = 'CloudCortex' ;
            }
            else{
                referer = 'Cortex' ;
            }	    
	}
        else if(((pcontainer) && pcontainer.indexOf('Sase')!=-1)){
	    referer = 'Sase' ;
	}
	else if(((pcontainer) && pcontainer.indexOf('Unit')!=-1)){
	    referer = 'Unit' ;
	}
	else if(((pcontainer) && pcontainer.indexOf('Ngfw')!=-1)){
	    referer = 'Ngfw' ;
	}
        var fromRef = document.referrer;
        var nContainer = getCookie("navContainer");
        if(nContainer){//If user is coming from main site, we need to reset the container		
		if(fromRef  && fromRef.indexOf("prismacloud.io")!=-1){
                        referer = 'Prisma' ;
                        sessionStorage.setItem("container","Prisma");
                } else if(fromRef.indexOf("paloaltonetworks.com")!=-1 || fromRef.indexOf("paloaltonetworks.jp")!=-1 ){
                        if(nContainer.indexOf('Prisma') != -1){
                            referer = 'Prisma' ;
                            sessionStorage.setItem("container","Prisma");
                        }
                        if(nContainer.indexOf('Cortex') != -1){
                            if( nContainer.indexOf('CloudCortex') != -1){
                                referer = 'CloudCortex';
                                sessionStorage.setItem("container","CloudCortex");
                            }
                            else{
                                referer = 'Cortex';
                                sessionStorage.setItem("container","Cortex");
                            }                            
                        }
			if(nContainer.indexOf('Sase') != -1){
                            referer = 'Sase' ;
                            sessionStorage.setItem("container","Sase");
                        }
			if(nContainer.indexOf('Unit') != -1){
                            referer = 'Unit' ;
                            sessionStorage.setItem("container","Unit");
                        }
			if(nContainer.indexOf('Ngfw') != -1){
                            referer = 'Ngfw' ;
                            sessionStorage.setItem("container","Ngfw");
                        }
			document.cookie = 'navContainer=; path=/; domain=.paloaltonetworks.com; expires=' + new Date(0).toUTCString();
		}
	}
if(referer != "Prisma" && referer != "CloudCortex" && referer != "Cortex" && referer != "Sase" && referer != "Unit" && referer != "Ngfw") {
    referer = 'Unit' ;
    sessionStorage.setItem("container","Unit");
}
function callMainSitePrismaNavHTML(){
    
    var referrer_domain = 'https://www.paloaltonetworks.com';
    sessionStorage.setItem("domain",referrer_domain);
    if(referer == 'Prisma'){
        //var menu_url = referrer_domain+'/_jcr_content/globals/cleanHeaderPrisma.prismaRenderer.html';
        var menu_url = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/unit-nav-renderer.php?type=prisma&domain=en';
        searchResultsPagePath = referrer_domain+"/search/prismasearch";
        }
    if(referer == 'CloudCortex'){
        var menu_url = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/unit-nav-renderer.php?type=cortexcloud&domain=en';
        searchResultsPagePath = referrer_domain+"/search/cortexcloudsearch";	
    }
    if(referer == 'Cortex'){
        //var menu_url = referrer_domain+'/_jcr_content/globals/cleanHeaderCortex.cortexRenderer.html';	
        var menu_url = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/unit-nav-renderer.php?type=cortex&domain=en';	
        searchResultsPagePath = referrer_domain+"/search/cortexsearch";	
    }
    if(referer == 'Sase'){
        //var menu_url = referrer_domain+'/_jcr_content/globals/cleanHeaderSase.saseRenderer.html';
        var menu_url = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/unit-nav-renderer.php?type=sase&domain=en';
        searchResultsPagePath = referrer_domain+"/search/sasesearch";
    }
    if(referer == 'Unit'){
        var menu_url = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/unit-nav-renderer.php?type=unit42&domain=en';
        searchResultsPagePath = referrer_domain+"/content/pan/en_US/search/unit42search";
		    }
    if(referer == 'Ngfw'){
        //var menu_url = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/ngfw-cdss-nav-renderer.php';
        var menu_url = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/unit-nav-renderer.php?type=ngfw&domain=en'; 
        searchResultsPagePath = referrer_domain+"/search/ngfwcdsssearch";
    }
    httpGet(menu_url,'menu_html');
    document.getElementById('main-nav-menu-cont').removeAttribute("style");
}
function addStyle(styles) {            
    /* Create style document */
    var css = document.createElement('style');
    css.type = 'text/css';

    if (css.styleSheet) 
        css.styleSheet.cssText = styles;
    else 
        css.appendChild(document.createTextNode(styles));

    /* Append style to the tag name */
    document.getElementsByTagName("head")[0].appendChild(css);
}
function httpGet(theUrl,req_type) {
    if (window.XMLHttpRequest) { // code for IE7+, Firefox, Chrome, Opera, Safari
        xmlhttp=new XMLHttpRequest();
    } else {// code for IE6, IE5
        xmlhttp=new ActiveXObject("Microsoft.XMLHTTP");
    }
    xmlhttp.onreadystatechange=function()
    {
        if (xmlhttp.readyState==4 && xmlhttp.status==200)
        {
            if(req_type == 'menu_html'){
            var nav_text = xmlhttp.responseText.replaceAll('https://static.cloud.coveo.com/searchui/v2.9159/js/CoveoJsSearch.Lazy.min.js', '');
            nav_text = nav_text.replaceAll('src="/', 'src="'+maindomain_lang+'/');
            nav_text = nav_text.replaceAll("'/content", "'"+maindomain_lang+"/content");
                        
            document.getElementById("PAN_2021_NAV_ASYNC").innerHTML = nav_text.replaceAll('href="/', 'href="'+maindomain_lang+'/');

            var lozad_back = document.getElementsByClassName('lozad-background');
            Array.prototype.forEach.call(lozad_back, function(el) {
            // Do stuff here
            var el_back_img_path = el.getAttribute('data-background-image');
            var first_pos = el_back_img_path.indexOf("'");
            var last_pos = el_back_img_path.indexOf("'",first_pos+1);
            el_back_img_path = el_back_img_path.substring(first_pos+1,last_pos);
            el.setAttribute("data-background-image",main_site_url+el_back_img_path);
            });
            const observer_lozad = lozad('.lozad, .lozad-background'); // lazy loads elements with default selector as '.lozad'
            observer_lozad.observe();
            }
            if(req_type == 'head_inline_css'){
            addStyle(xmlhttp.responseText);
            }
        }
    }
    xmlhttp.open("GET", theUrl, true );
    xmlhttp.send();    
}    
    
if(referer == 'Prisma' || referer == 'CloudCortex' || referer == 'Cortex' || referer == 'Sase' || referer == 'Unit' || referer == 'Ngfw'){
    const article = document.querySelector('#PAN_2021_NAV_ASYNC');
    if(referer == 'Prisma'){
        article.dataset.type = 'prisma';
        $('#PAN_2021_NAV_ASYNC').removeClass('default').addClass('defaultRedesigned');
    }
    else if(referer == 'CloudCortex'){
        article.dataset.type = 'cloudcortex';
    }
    else if(referer == 'Cortex'){
        article.dataset.type = 'cortex';
    }
    else if(referer == 'Sase'){
        article.dataset.type = 'sase';
    }
    else if(referer == 'Unit'){
        article.dataset.type = 'unit';
    }
    else if(referer == 'Ngfw'){
        article.dataset.type = 'ngfw';
    }
    //set class to default
    if(referer == 'Unit' || referer == 'Ngfw'){
        $('#PAN_2021_NAV_ASYNC').removeClass('default').addClass('defaultRedesigned');
    }
    callMainSitePrismaNavHTML();
}
</script>
<!--  End: Scripts Migrated From Unit42-v5 -->



<main class="main">

      </section> 
    <section class="section blog-contents"> 
      <div class="pa blog-editor">
        <div class="l-container">
          <div class="be__wrapper">
            <div class="be__contents">
              <div class="be__contents-wrapper">
                <h2><a id="post-152030-_ovcrhxovgaz1"></a>Executive Summary</h2>
<p>The rapid expansion of generative AI (GenAI) has led to a diverse set of web-based platforms offering capabilities such as code assistance, natural language generation, chatbot interaction and automated website creation. This article uses insights from our telemetry to show trends in how the GenAI web is evolving.</p>
<p>Because of its growing prevalence, GenAI also opens new vectors for threat actors to misuse. Adversaries are increasingly leveraging GenAI platforms to create realistic phishing content, clone trusted brands and automate large-scale deployment using services like low-code site builders. The threats are getting harder to detect.</p>
<p>We examine specific misuse scenarios including AI-generated phishing pages and malicious chatbots. We also provide indicators of these activities to support detection and response efforts.</p>
<p>Palo Alto Networks customers are better protected from the threats described in this article by the following products and services:</p>
<p><a href="https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/advanced-url-filtering/administration" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Advanced URL Filtering</a> and <a href="https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/dns-security" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Advanced DNS Security</a> identify known domains and URLs associated with this activity as malicious.</p>
<p>If you think you might have been compromised or have an urgent matter, contact the <a href="https://start.paloaltonetworks.com/contact-unit42.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Unit 42 Incident Response team</a>.</p>
<table style="width: 100%;">
<thead>
<tr>
<td style="width: 35%;"><b>Related Unit 42 Topics</b></td>
<td style="width: 100%;"><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/tag/genai/" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><b>GenAI</b></a>, <strong><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/tag/phishing/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Phishing</a></strong></td>
</tr>
</thead>
</table>
<h2><a id="post-152030-_xkrilzfpzb2s"></a>Increase in the Use of GenAI</h2>
<h3><a id="post-152030-_kvbvyb59692u"></a>Introduction to Web-Based AI Services</h3>
<p>GenAI has fueled a surge of new websites and platforms, from conversational assistants to multi-media creation tools. As the ecosystem evolves, we identify emerging patterns in how people are adopting different categories of AI services.</p>
<p>Writing assistants, meeting tools, code generators and website builders are streamlining tasks that previously demanded substantial manual effort, signaling a shift in how work is created and delivered across domains.These AI tools streamline workflows, reduce manual effort and enable new forms of content creation.</p>
<p>We are observing a significant upward trend in GenAI adoption across industries, particularly following the surge of public interest and innovation in the AI space. Within just six months, AI use has more than doubled and continues to grow steadily, as shown in Figure 1.</p>
<p>The blue line represents the number of AI website visits in billions, from April 2024-April 2025. The red bars indicate the number of new websites hosting AI services detected in millions. This overall trend of increased traffic to AI websites indicates a growing adoption of GenAI applications and services.</p>
<figure id="attachment_152042" aria-describedby="caption-attachment-152042" style="width: 1000px" class="wp-caption alignnone"><img  class="wp-image-152042 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/chart-4.png" alt="Bar chart and line graph showing new AI host launches in millions and AI website visits in billions from 2024-04 to 2025-04. Host launches visualized by red bars and website visits by a blue line. Palo Alto Networks and Unit 42 logo lockup." width="1000" height="619" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/chart-4.png 2048w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/chart-4-711x440.png 711w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/chart-4-1131x700.png 1131w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/chart-4-768x475.png 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/chart-4-1536x950.png 1536w" sizes="(max-width: 1000px) 100vw, 1000px" /><figcaption id="caption-attachment-152042" class="wp-caption-text">Figure 1. Month-over-month trends in AI website traffic and growth from April 2024 to April 2025.</figcaption></figure>
<h3><a id="post-152030-_szvlexic502r"></a>AI Service Trends and Industry Focus</h3>
<p>We discuss how people are adopting AI-specific capabilities so we can better predict how those various functions can introduce new risks. A further review of our telemetry reveals:</p>
<ul>
<li>The top industries leading AI adoption include:
<ul>
<li>High tech</li>
<li>Education</li>
<li>Telecommunications</li>
<li>Professional and legal services</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>The high tech sector dominates AI use, accounting for over 70% of total GenAI tool use shown in Figure 2</li>
<li>Most of this activity is concentrated in text-generation applications (such as writing assistants and AI chatbots) and media-generation tools, as shown in Figure 3</li>
<li>About 16% of AI service use is dedicated to data processing and workflow automation, such as email campaign generation</li>
</ul>
<figure id="attachment_152291" aria-describedby="caption-attachment-152291" style="width: 900px" class="wp-caption alignnone"><img  class="wp-image-152291 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/chart-3-01-scaled.png" alt="Pie chart showing sector distribution for AI services. 'High Tech' sector dominates at 74.0%, followed by 'Other' at 3.3%, 'State and local government' at less than 1%, 'Manufacturing' at 1.50%, 'Wholesale &amp; Retail' at 1.2%, 'Professional &amp; Legal Services' at 3.1%, and 'Telecommunications' at 5.6%. 'Education' is at 9.1%. Palo Alto Networks and Unit 42 logo lockup." width="900" height="609" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/chart-3-01-scaled.png 2560w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/chart-3-01-650x440.png 650w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/chart-3-01-1034x700.png 1034w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/chart-3-01-768x520.png 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/chart-3-01-1536x1040.png 1536w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/chart-3-01-2048x1386.png 2048w" sizes="(max-width: 900px) 100vw, 900px" /><figcaption id="caption-attachment-152291" class="wp-caption-text">Figure 3. Distribution of AI categories across all industries.</figcaption></figure>
<figure id="attachment_152064" aria-describedby="caption-attachment-152064" style="width: 900px" class="wp-caption alignnone"><img  class="wp-image-152064 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-801848-152030-3.png" alt="Pie chart showing the distribution of tasks managed by AI technologies. Segments include Media Generator at 24.5%, AI Data and Workflow at 15.8%, Chatbot at 13.2%, Code Assistant at 2.5%, Meeting Assistant at 1.3%, Website Generator at 4.3%, AI Platform &amp; Service at 6.6%, and Writing Assistant at 31.8%. Palo Alto Networks and Unit 42 logo lockup." width="900" height="711" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-801848-152030-3.png 2048w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-801848-152030-3-557x440.png 557w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-801848-152030-3-886x700.png 886w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-801848-152030-3-768x607.png 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-801848-152030-3-1536x1214.png 1536w" sizes="(max-width: 900px) 100vw, 900px" /><figcaption id="caption-attachment-152064" class="wp-caption-text">Figure 3. Distribution of AI categories across all industries.</figcaption></figure>
<h2><a id="post-152030-_xvvwns7t8ib0"></a>Overview of Phishing Attacks Misusing Various Types of AI Services</h2>
<p>While GenAI tools offer powerful capabilities, they also introduce significant risks that threat actors can exploit for phishing and other types of cyberattacks.</p>
<ul>
<li>AI code assistants can significantly enhance software development. They provide real-time coding suggestions, automate code generation and can reduce errors. However, they can inadvertently expose proprietary code or sensitive intellectual property, creating entry points for targeted attacks.</li>
<li>Text generation tools — such as conversational, writing and meeting assistants — can enhance productivity, content creation and customer interaction. However, attackers can manipulate them to generate convincing phishing content, spread misinformation or leak confidential data.</li>
<li>AI model services simplify deployment, training and inference. However, they can expose sensitive models or data to unauthorized access. This increases the risk of model hijacking or misuse in malicious workflows.</li>
<li>Attackers can use multi-media AI tools — including media generators and website builders — to rapidly create realistic-looking but fraudulent websites, <a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/dynamics-of-deepfake-scams/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">deepfake content</a> and deceptive phishing pages to mimic trusted brands.</li>
<li>AI-powered data platforms and workflow automation tools optimize business processes, improve efficiency and support informed decision-making. When loosely governed, they can become vectors for data leakage, unauthorized access and automated exploitation across integrated systems.</li>
</ul>
<p>Collectively, these risks underscore the potential of GenAI to amplify phishing campaigns and other social engineering threats. Therefore, stronger safeguards and threat detection are necessary.</p>
<p>Figure 4 shows the top three AI services misused for phishing include:</p>
<ul>
<li>Website generators (approximately 40%)</li>
<li>Writing assistants (approximately 30%)</li>
<li>Chatbots (almost 11%)</li>
</ul>
<figure id="attachment_152075" aria-describedby="caption-attachment-152075" style="width: 2048px" class="wp-caption alignnone"><img  class="wp-image-152075 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-805582-152030-4.png" alt="Pie chart showing the distribution of AI services misused for phishing attacks. 'Website generator' leads with 40.4%, followed by 'Writing assistant' at 29.6%, 'Chatbot' at 10.5%, 'Media generator' at 8.4%, 'AI platform and service' at 4.1%, 'Meeting assistant' at 3.5%, 'AI data and workflow' at 3.2%, and 'Code assistant' with 0.3%. Palo Alto Networks and Unit 42 logo lockup." width="2048" height="1348" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-805582-152030-4.png 2048w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-805582-152030-4-668x440.png 668w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-805582-152030-4-1064x700.png 1064w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-805582-152030-4-768x506.png 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-805582-152030-4-1536x1011.png 1536w" sizes="(max-width: 2048px) 100vw, 2048px" /><figcaption id="caption-attachment-152075" class="wp-caption-text">Figure 4. Distribution of categories of AI services misused for phishing attacks.</figcaption></figure>
<h3><a id="post-152030-_flkr5ehte7wk"></a>Misuse of Website Generation Services</h3>
<p>Although these services are relatively new, attackers are already misusing AI-powered website builders for real-world phishing attacks.</p>
<p>We observed phishing websites that threat actors created using a popular AI-powered website builder, which is capable of producing websites within seconds. This platform allows someone to enter a prompt that can build and publish websites without any email or phone verification. The site uses AI to generate images and text based on this prompt, for creating a website.</p>
<p>We detected two real-world examples of AI-generated phishing landing pages in May 2025. Both of these phishing pages, shown in Figures 5 and 6, link to attacker-owned credential-stealing sites.</p>
<figure id="attachment_152086" aria-describedby="caption-attachment-152086" style="width: 1000px" class="wp-caption alignnone"><img  class="wp-image-152086 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-809134-152030-5.png" alt="Promotional webpage featuring a &quot;FREE COUPON&quot; to unlock a 12-month Standard Plan at 100% off, with a button labeled 'Show Coupon Code' followed by another button that says 'Click here'. The background includes a blurred image of shapes in red and black." width="1000" height="421" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-809134-152030-5.png 1716w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-809134-152030-5-786x331.png 786w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-809134-152030-5-1664x700.png 1664w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-809134-152030-5-768x323.png 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-809134-152030-5-1536x646.png 1536w" sizes="(max-width: 1000px) 100vw, 1000px" /><figcaption id="caption-attachment-152086" class="wp-caption-text">Figure 5. Screenshot of the phishing page seen in May 2025.</figcaption></figure>
<figure id="attachment_152097" aria-describedby="caption-attachment-152097" style="width: 1000px" class="wp-caption alignnone"><img  class="wp-image-152097 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-813572-152030-6.png" alt="Screenshot of a website's 'Gift Card' promotional page showing three blurred images of cards with text overlays that promote different shopping benefits. The navigation menu includes options for Home, About, Products, and Contact." width="1000" height="502" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-813572-152030-6.png 2048w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-813572-152030-6-786x395.png 786w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-813572-152030-6-1395x700.png 1395w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-813572-152030-6-768x386.png 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-813572-152030-6-1536x771.png 1536w" sizes="(max-width: 1000px) 100vw, 1000px" /><figcaption id="caption-attachment-152097" class="wp-caption-text">Figure 6. Screenshot of the phishing page seen in May 2025.</figcaption></figure>
<p>Some of the AI-assisted website builders we investigated appear to lack guardrails that would prevent someone from impersonating an existing business or organization. As a test, we used a known AI-assisted website builder to create a fake page to appear as if it’s for Palo Alto Networks.</p>
<p>The website builder only required a valid email address (not necessarily a Palo Alto Networks email address) to establish a trial account and publish a page impersonating our company. Since these pages are intended to quickly establish a web presence for a new company or organization, they lack the design elements that criminals would otherwise use to spoof a targeted brand.</p>
<p>In our test, the website builder promised to generate a free AI website in 60 seconds, which is an accurate statement. Our only input was a brief description of the company for an initial text prompt. Figure 7 shows a brief description of Palo Alto Networks we typed in the initial prompt before clicking on the “Enhance Prompt” button.</p>
<figure id="attachment_152108" aria-describedby="caption-attachment-152108" style="width: 1000px" class="wp-caption alignnone"><img  class="wp-image-152108 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-817767-152030-7.jpeg" alt="Website builder using AI. Generate a free AI website in 60 seconds. Below is a prompt window with the input &quot;Palo Alto Networks is a leading cybersecurity company that has next generation firewalls and other security solutions. A giant cursor is about to select the Enhance Prompt button. " width="1000" height="520" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-817767-152030-7.jpeg 1920w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-817767-152030-7-786x409.jpeg 786w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-817767-152030-7-1347x700.jpeg 1347w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-817767-152030-7-768x399.jpeg 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-817767-152030-7-1536x798.jpeg 1536w" sizes="(max-width: 1000px) 100vw, 1000px" /><figcaption id="caption-attachment-152108" class="wp-caption-text">Figure 7. A brief description of our company in a prompt from the AI-assisted website builder.</figcaption></figure>
<p>The Enhance Prompt button took our initial input and created a complete AI prompt for the page, as shown below in Figure 8. The finished prompt included an AI-generated paragraph about the company, a default design style that can easily be modified and a list of content to include on the site.</p>
<figure id="attachment_152119" aria-describedby="caption-attachment-152119" style="width: 1000px" class="wp-caption alignnone"><img  class="wp-image-152119 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-821843-152030-8.jpeg" alt="Screenshot of a webpage with text describing Palo Alto Networks' commitment to innovation and cybersecurity, featuring a section on business/project name alongside company's mission and services. Cursor is hovering over the up arrow on the right. " width="1000" height="708" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-821843-152030-8.jpeg 2048w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-821843-152030-8-622x440.jpeg 622w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-821843-152030-8-989x700.jpeg 989w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-821843-152030-8-768x543.jpeg 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-821843-152030-8-1536x1087.jpeg 1536w" sizes="(max-width: 1000px) 100vw, 1000px" /><figcaption id="caption-attachment-152119" class="wp-caption-text">Figure 8. The enhanced prompt from the AI-assisted website builder.</figcaption></figure>
<p>We then clicked on the arrow button noted in Figure 8, and the builder took approximately 5-10 seconds to create a staging environment for the site. From a hastily typed initial prompt of “Palo Alto Networks is a leading cybersecurity company that has next-generation firewalls and other security solutions,” the resulting page Figure 9 shows looks plausible for a cybersecurity company.</p>
<figure id="attachment_152130" aria-describedby="caption-attachment-152130" style="width: 1000px" class="wp-caption alignnone"><img  class="wp-image-152130 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-825424-152030-9.jpeg" alt="A professional at a workstation with multiple screens displaying data, on the fake and AI-generated Palo Alto Networks website, with text that reads &quot;Cybersecurity redefined - Protect your assets with confidence&quot; and a &quot;View Services&quot; button." width="1000" height="707" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-825424-152030-9.jpeg 2048w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-825424-152030-9-623x440.jpeg 623w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-825424-152030-9-991x700.jpeg 991w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-825424-152030-9-768x543.jpeg 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-825424-152030-9-1536x1085.jpeg 1536w" sizes="(max-width: 1000px) 100vw, 1000px" /><figcaption id="caption-attachment-152130" class="wp-caption-text">Figure 9. Index page generated by the AI-assisted website builder.</figcaption></figure>
<p>Scrolling through the index page generated by the site builder, we found a convincing AI-generated description of our company, as shown in Figure 10.</p>
<figure id="attachment_152141" aria-describedby="caption-attachment-152141" style="width: 1000px" class="wp-caption alignnone"><img  class="wp-image-152141 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-829649-152030-10.jpeg" alt="Fake AI-generated homepage of Palo Alto Networks website featuring a professional in front of digital screens, with text about leading cybersecurity solutions." width="1000" height="707" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-829649-152030-10.jpeg 2048w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-829649-152030-10-623x440.jpeg 623w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-829649-152030-10-991x700.jpeg 991w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-829649-152030-10-768x543.jpeg 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-829649-152030-10-1536x1085.jpeg 1536w" sizes="(max-width: 1000px) 100vw, 1000px" /><figcaption id="caption-attachment-152141" class="wp-caption-text">Figure 10. Company description in a page generated by the AI-assisted website builder.</figcaption></figure>
<p>The index page included links to different pages that contain descriptions of next-generation firewalls, cloud security solutions and threat intelligence services. Figure 11 shows a link from the index page for threat intelligence services and the resulting page from that link. Like the company description, the description of these services mimics what most people would expect from an established cybersecurity company.</p>
<figure id="attachment_152152" aria-describedby="caption-attachment-152152" style="width: 1000px" class="wp-caption alignnone"><img  class="wp-image-152152 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-833096-152030-11.jpeg" alt="Screenshot collage of fake AI-generated Palo Alto Networks website featuring sections on cloud security, threat intelligence, and advanced threat protection services with images of network security operations and descriptive text about cybersecurity solutions." width="1000" height="721" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-833096-152030-11.jpeg 2048w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-833096-152030-11-610x440.jpeg 610w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-833096-152030-11-971x700.jpeg 971w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-833096-152030-11-768x554.jpeg 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-833096-152030-11-1536x1108.jpeg 1536w" sizes="(max-width: 1000px) 100vw, 1000px" /><figcaption id="caption-attachment-152152" class="wp-caption-text">Figure 11. Threat intelligence services page generated by the AI-assisted website builder.</figcaption></figure>
<p>The website builder includes a button to publish the site. Pushing this button generated the dialogue window shown in Figure 12.</p>
<figure id="attachment_152163" aria-describedby="caption-attachment-152163" style="width: 1000px" class="wp-caption alignnone"><img  class="wp-image-152163 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-836725-152030-12.jpeg" alt="A screenshot of a website editor interface from the fake AI-generated Palo Alto Networks, showing a pop-up window titled &quot;Publish website.&quot; The pop-up prompts the user to add a custom domain with pricing information and subscription plans. Buttons for &quot;View plans,&quot; &quot;Cancel,&quot; and &quot;Publish&quot; are visible." width="1000" height="707" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-836725-152030-12.jpeg 2048w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-836725-152030-12-623x440.jpeg 623w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-836725-152030-12-991x700.jpeg 991w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-836725-152030-12-768x543.jpeg 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-836725-152030-12-1536x1085.jpeg 1536w" sizes="(max-width: 1000px) 100vw, 1000px" /><figcaption id="caption-attachment-152163" class="wp-caption-text">Figure 12. Dialogue window to publish the site from our test.</figcaption></figure>
<p>While we did not publish this fake Palo Alto Networks site, cybercriminals have misused this builder to publish phishing pages mimicking other brands, such as the two real-world examples we previously referenced.</p>
<p>Attackers can replicate similar attack vectors on other website builder platforms since many of these platforms have recently added AI-assisted features. Figure 13 shows an example of a fake gift card site spoofing popular vendors created through a popular website builder.</p>
<figure id="attachment_152174" aria-describedby="caption-attachment-152174" style="width: 1000px" class="wp-caption alignnone"><img  class="wp-image-152174 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-840178-152030-13.png" alt="Promotional website banner for gift card scam website saying 'Joy in Every Card' featuring the 'Explore' button and an image of a hand holding a glowing card. Below are displayed various card offerings including Store Credit, Discount Voucher, Gift Card, and Subscription Credit with listed prices." width="1000" height="777" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-840178-152030-13.png 2048w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-840178-152030-13-566x440.png 566w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-840178-152030-13-901x700.png 901w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-840178-152030-13-768x597.png 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-840178-152030-13-1536x1194.png 1536w" sizes="(max-width: 1000px) 100vw, 1000px" /><figcaption id="caption-attachment-152174" class="wp-caption-text">Figure 13. Webpage for discounted gift cards generated on another popular AI-powered website builder.</figcaption></figure>
<p>Currently, the real-world phishing attacks seen on AI-powered website builders appear relatively rudimentary and might not deceive most potential victims. However, in the medium to long term, we expect that these attacks will become more convincing as AI-powered website builders grow more powerful.</p>
<h3><a id="post-152030-_7veqifdd078a"></a>Misuse of Writing Assistant Services</h3>
<p>In addition to website builders, we identified multiple real-world phishing URLs generated and hosted on third-party AI writing assistant platforms. In all these cases, the attacker used the app to host a phishing page. The phishing page displays a generic message like “You have new documents — click the button to view.” Clicking the button leads the victim to a secondary credential-stealing site, such as a fake Microsoft login page.</p>
<p>Despite being hosted on platforms that offer AI-powered content generation, these phishing pages are quite simple and show no clear signs of AI involvement (see Figures 14 and 15). This type of activity is similar to what we’ve seen in software as service <a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/platform-abuse-phishing/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">(SaaS) platform misuse campaigns</a>, such as phishing pages hosted on presentation builders or other legitimate content-sharing tools.</p>
<figure id="attachment_152185" aria-describedby="caption-attachment-152185" style="width: 1000px" class="wp-caption alignnone"><img  class="wp-image-152185 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-848290-152030-14.png" alt="Screenshot of a digital document sharing interface titled &quot;SECURE BUSINESS DOCUMENTS. Features include a link to &quot;VIEW PDF ONLINE&quot; and additional sections for login, author details, and an activation reminder for Windows." width="1000" height="483" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-848290-152030-14.png 1600w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-848290-152030-14-786x379.png 786w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-848290-152030-14-1451x700.png 1451w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-848290-152030-14-768x371.png 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-848290-152030-14-1536x741.png 1536w" sizes="(max-width: 1000px) 100vw, 1000px" /><figcaption id="caption-attachment-152185" class="wp-caption-text">Figure 14. Screenshot of a phishing page created on an SEO assistant platform.</figcaption></figure>
<figure id="attachment_152196" aria-describedby="caption-attachment-152196" style="width: 1000px" class="wp-caption alignnone"><img  class="wp-image-152196 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-851771-152030-15.png" alt="Screenshot of document sharing service with a PDF document ready to be shared. There is a button labeled &quot;VIEW DOCUMENT,&quot; followed by a signature from someone purported to be &quot;Kim Cromidas&quot; with some information redacted for security reasons." width="1000" height="483" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-851771-152030-15.png 1600w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-851771-152030-15-786x379.png 786w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-851771-152030-15-1451x700.png 1451w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-851771-152030-15-768x371.png 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-851771-152030-15-1536x741.png 1536w" sizes="(max-width: 1000px) 100vw, 1000px" /><figcaption id="caption-attachment-152196" class="wp-caption-text">Figure 15. Screenshot of the phishing page created on a sales assistant platform.</figcaption></figure>
<p>While attackers might leverage the AI functionality of these platforms in more powerful ways in the future, they are currently using these platforms primarily as a hosting service for malicious content.</p>
<h2><a id="post-152030-_2an8ryq91inv"></a>Conclusion</h2>
<p>In this article, we discussed web-based GenAI services and reviewed phishing attacks that misused them. We investigated examples of phishing pages from AI-powered website builders, and explored how criminals can use these builders to create phishing content more easily. Criminals have also misused AI-powered writing assistant services, but these platforms have been used primarily as a hosting service for malicious content with no clear signs of AI involvement.</p>
<p>Our telemetry reflects the growing adoption of GenAI applications and services, and we expect a corresponding increase in attacks that take advantage of GenAI as time passes.</p>
<p>Palo Alto Networks customers are better protected from the threats discussed in this article through the following products:</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/advanced-url-filtering/administration" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Advanced URL Filtering</a> and <a href="https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/dns-security" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Advanced DNS Security</a> identify known domains and URLs associated with this activity as malicious.</li>
</ul>
<p>If you think you may have been compromised or have an urgent matter, get in touch with the <a href="https://start.paloaltonetworks.com/contact-unit42.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Unit 42 Incident Response team</a> or call:</p>
<ul>
<li>North America: Toll Free: +1 (866) 486-4842 (866.4.UNIT42)</li>
<li>UK: +44.20.3743.3660</li>
<li>Europe and Middle East: +31.20.299.3130</li>
<li>Asia: +65.6983.8730</li>
<li>Japan: +81.50.1790.0200</li>
<li>Australia: +61.2.4062.7950</li>
<li>India: 00080005045107</li>
</ul>
<p>Palo Alto Networks has shared these findings with our fellow Cyber Threat Alliance (CTA) members. CTA members use this intelligence to rapidly deploy protections to their customers and to systematically disrupt malicious cyber actors. Learn more about the <a href="https://www.cyberthreatalliance.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Cyber Threat Alliance</a>.</p>
<h2><a id="post-152030-_762ykgk9mp5k"></a>Acknowledgments</h2>
<p>Thanks to Peng Peng for his research into malicious chatbots, as well as Alex Starov and Jun Javier Wang for their suggestions.</p>
<h2><a id="post-152030-_4aduqvthp4dc"></a>Appendix</h2>
<p>Additional screenshots of GenAI-related phishing pages we found in the wild are shown in Figures 16-22.</p>
<figure id="attachment_152266" aria-describedby="caption-attachment-152266" style="width: 1000px" class="wp-caption alignnone"><img  class="wp-image-152266 size-full lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/F16.png" alt="Website header displaying a &quot;Free Coupon&quot; banner, featuring images of a wooden table with European currency notes beside a box with pine cones, with text encouraging to &quot;Unlock your savings today!&quot;" width="1000" height="339" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/F16.png 1000w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/F16-786x266.png 786w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/F16-768x260.png 768w" sizes="(max-width: 1000px) 100vw, 1000px" /><figcaption id="caption-attachment-152266" class="wp-caption-text">Figure 16. An additional screenshot of the phishing site from Figure 5.</figcaption></figure>
<figure id="attachment_152277" aria-describedby="caption-attachment-152277" style="width: 1000px" class="wp-caption alignnone"><img  class="wp-image-152277 size-full lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/F17.png" alt="Background of densely arranged pages, possibly documents or forms, with an overlay text saying &quot;SECURE DOCUMENT&quot; and a button labeled &quot;VIEW DOCUMENT&quot;." width="1000" height="910" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/F17.png 1000w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/F17-484x440.png 484w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/F17-769x700.png 769w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/F17-768x699.png 768w" sizes="(max-width: 1000px) 100vw, 1000px" /><figcaption id="caption-attachment-152277" class="wp-caption-text">Figure 17. Screenshot of a phishing page hosted on an AI-powered website platform initially sent via a phishing email. This webpage links to a fake login page for a popular web-based service.</figcaption></figure>
<figure id="attachment_152207" aria-describedby="caption-attachment-152207" style="width: 1000px" class="wp-caption alignnone"><img  class="wp-image-152207 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-868715-152030-18.png" alt="Collage of six images depicting various technology and lifestyle products on sale. The prices range from $1 to $20. " width="1000" height="595" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-868715-152030-18.png 2048w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-868715-152030-18-740x440.png 740w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-868715-152030-18-1177x700.png 1177w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-868715-152030-18-768x457.png 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-868715-152030-18-1536x914.png 1536w" sizes="(max-width: 1000px) 100vw, 1000px" /><figcaption id="caption-attachment-152207" class="wp-caption-text">Figure 18. Spoofed gift card shopping page generated on a website builder.</figcaption></figure>
<figure id="attachment_152218" aria-describedby="caption-attachment-152218" style="width: 1000px" class="wp-caption alignnone"><img  class="wp-image-152218 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-875963-152030-19.png" alt="A notification on a computer screen displaying a message titled &quot;New Completed PDF Document Received.&quot; The email informs the recipient of a new PDF document ready for review and includes a red &quot;Review Completed Documents&quot; button." width="1000" height="494" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-875963-152030-19.png 2048w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-875963-152030-19-786x388.png 786w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-875963-152030-19-1418x700.png 1418w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-875963-152030-19-768x379.png 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-875963-152030-19-1536x758.png 1536w" sizes="(max-width: 1000px) 100vw, 1000px" /><figcaption id="caption-attachment-152218" class="wp-caption-text">Figure 19. Screenshot of a phishing page generated using an AI-powered design assistant site.</figcaption></figure>
<figure id="attachment_152229" aria-describedby="caption-attachment-152229" style="width: 1000px" class="wp-caption alignnone"><img  class="wp-image-152229 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-880290-152030-20.png" alt="A notification on a computer screen displaying a message titled &quot;New Completed PDF Document Received.&quot; The email informs the recipient of a new PDF document ready for review and includes a red &quot;Review Completed Documents&quot; button." width="1000" height="467" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-880290-152030-20.png 2048w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-880290-152030-20-786x367.png 786w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-880290-152030-20-1500x700.png 1500w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-880290-152030-20-768x359.png 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-880290-152030-20-1536x717.png 1536w" sizes="(max-width: 1000px) 100vw, 1000px" /><figcaption id="caption-attachment-152229" class="wp-caption-text">Figure 20. Screenshot of a phishing page generated on an AI-powered design assistant site.</figcaption></figure>
<figure id="attachment_152240" aria-describedby="caption-attachment-152240" style="width: 1000px" class="wp-caption alignnone"><img  class="wp-image-152240 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-884856-152030-21.png" alt="Phishing page screenshot showing a car, TVs, and other items with a KLIK CEK KUPON button." width="1000" height="546" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-884856-152030-21.png 2048w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-884856-152030-21-786x429.png 786w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-884856-152030-21-1281x700.png 1281w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-884856-152030-21-768x420.png 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-884856-152030-21-1536x839.png 1536w" sizes="(max-width: 1000px) 100vw, 1000px" /><figcaption id="caption-attachment-152240" class="wp-caption-text">Figure 21. Screenshot of a landing phishing page generated on a no-code app builder.</figcaption></figure>
<figure id="attachment_152251" aria-describedby="caption-attachment-152251" style="width: 1000px" class="wp-caption alignnone"><img  class="wp-image-152251 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-890499-152030-22.png" alt="Phishing page screenshot showing a message that reads &quot;You Have 2 New Fax Documents&quot; with an option to &quot;Get Your Files Here.&quot; The format is PDF and the status is delivered. The interface includes colorful icons and buttons. " width="1000" height="416" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-890499-152030-22.png 1999w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-890499-152030-22-786x327.png 786w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-890499-152030-22-1684x700.png 1684w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-890499-152030-22-768x319.png 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/word-image-890499-152030-22-1536x639.png 1536w" sizes="(max-width: 1000px) 100vw, 1000px" /><figcaption id="caption-attachment-152251" class="wp-caption-text">Figure 22. Screenshot of a phishing page generated on an AI-powered educational platform.</figcaption></figure>
      
              </div>

            <h2>Related Business Email Compromise Resources</h2>

                    <h4 class="post-title">2025 Unit 42 Global Incident Response Report: Social Engineering Edition</h4>
                  </a>
                  <ul class="card-tags" role="list">
				<li role="listitem">

                  </a>

              </div>
            </div>
                                <div class="pa l-card l-card--slider" >
              <div class="card-media " >
                              <figure>
                <img width="786" height="368" src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/01_Business_email_compromise_Category_1920x900-786x368.jpg" class="lozad" alt="Pictorial representation of homograph attacks. 3D illustration of an open laptop displaying an envelope icon on the screen, accompanied by a smartphone and tablet, all set against a dark background with neon lighting." decoding="async" srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/01_Business_email_compromise_Category_1920x900-786x368.jpg 786w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/01_Business_email_compromise_Category_1920x900-1493x700.jpg 1493w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/01_Business_email_compromise_Category_1920x900-768x360.jpg 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/01_Business_email_compromise_Category_1920x900-1536x720.jpg 1536w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/01_Business_email_compromise_Category_1920x900.jpg 1920w" sizes="(max-width: 786px) 100vw, 786px" />                </figure> 
                            </div>
              <div class="card-content">
                <div class="card-content__wrapper">
                  <a class="card-category" href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/category/threat-research/" role="link" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="genai-phishing-bait:related-resources:The Ηоmоgraph Illusion: Not Everything Is As It Seems:Threat Research"><span class=""><img src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/icon-threat-research.svg" alt=" category icon">Threat Research</span></a>                        <span class="post-pub-date"><time datetime="2025-07-25T21:00:13+00:00">July 25, 2025</time></span>
